abstract: Investors sent Gap‘s stock surging 7 percent on Monday amid reports that it might be considering a sale. But Wall Street analysts quickly pointed out some obstacles to an acquisition of the retail chain, whose casual fashions have been languishing on the racks in recent months. These include a generally lackluster demand for retail companies (as shown by last year’s failed auctions for Jones Apparel and Pep Boys) and Gap’s relatively small amount of real-estate assets, which could be used to defray the cost of a buyout.
lead_paragraph: Investors sent Gap‘s stock surging 7 percent on Monday amid reports that it might be considering a sale. But Wall Street analysts quickly pointed out some obstacles to an acquisition of the retail chain, whose casual fashions have been languishing on the racks in recent months. These include a generally lackluster demand for retail companies (as shown by last year’s failed auctions for Jones Apparel and Pep Boys) and Gap’s relatively small amount of real-estate assets, which could be used to defray the cost of a buyout.

headline.main: Gap Deal Would Face Many Hurdles, Analysts Say
